headline: Taco Chili from Publix
name: Taco Chili from Publix
description: Take a new look at a Southwestern favorite. Here's a low-maintenance recipe that's perfect for creating a lot of flavor in two easy steps. And this savory dish only gets better as a leftover.
recipeIngredient: 2 (10 ounce) cans diced tomatoes and green chiles, undrained
1 (15 ounce) can chili beans in sauce, undrained
1 (15.25 ounce) can southwest-style corn with peppers, drained

recipeInstructions.text: Preheat large, nonstick sauté pan on medium-high heat for 2 to 3 minutes. Place beef in pan (wash hands); brown for 5 to 7 minutes, stirring to crumble meat, or until no pink remains. Stir in taco seasoning; remove meat from pan.
Combine remaining ingredients in slow cooker; stir in meat. Cover and cook on High for 3 to 4 hours or on Low for 6 to 8 hours. Serve.
